iiv.display

Class SingleImg

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • iiv.display.DisplayComponent
            • iiv.display.SingleImg
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CoordinateMappable, ScaleInterface, LocationMapping, NumberFormattable, Overlayable, ShowPointImage, SliceNumbering, Croppable, FilterSampling, Flippable, Rotatable, Zoomable, CNUFileObject, iiVScriptable, ShowStatus, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntensityProjectionImage

    public class SingleImg
extends DisplayComponent
implements ScaleInterface, CoordinateMappable, SliceNumbering, CNUFileObject, Overlayable, NumberFormattable, iiVScriptable
    Component to display a single slice of CNUData as an image with flip, zoom and show point abilities.
    Since:
    iiV1.0
    See Also:
    CNUViewer, Container, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleImg

        public SingleImg()
        Constructs a new instance of SingleImg with no initialization. The init routine should be called soon after.

      • SingleImg

        public SingleImg(CNUData inImg,
                 int sliceViewMode,
                 int slice,
                 int iValue,
                 CNUScale sc)
        Constructs a new instance of SingleImg.
        Parameters:
        inImg - the data to retrieve image pixels from
        sliceViewMode - the slice orientation to display CNUDimensions.TRANSVERSE, CNUDimensions.CORONAL, CNUDimensions.SAGITTAL...
        slice - the slice number in the range from 0 to the number of slices for the sliceViewMode
        iValue - the 4th or i dimension to use for displaying a slice from 4 dimensional data
        sc - the scale object for mapping pixel values to indices in the color lookup table

      • SingleImg

        public SingleImg(CNUData inImg,
                 int sliceViewMode,
                 int slice,
                 int iValue)
        Constructs a new instance of SingleImg with default scaling.
        Parameters:
        inImg - the data to retrieve image pixels from
        sliceViewMode - the slice orientation to display CNUDimensions.TRANSVERSE, CNUDimensions.CORONAL, CNUDimensions.SAGITTAL...
        slice - the slice number in the range from 0 to the number of slices for the sliceViewMode
        iValue - the 4th or i dimension to use for displaying a slice from 4 dimensional data

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(CNUData inImg,
                 int sliceViewMode,
                 int slice,
                 int iValue,
                 CNUScale sc)
        Initializes an instance of SingleImg. Seperated from construction routines so subclasses can override functions called here and by using the no parameter constructer and this routine not fear thier local variables being available. (local subclass variables may not be initialized until the superclass constructor gets done).
        Parameters:
        inImg - the data to retrieve image pixels from
        sliceViewMode - the slice orientation to display CNUDimensions.TRANSVERSE, CNUDimensions.CORONAL, CNUDimensions.SAGITTAL...
        slice - the slice number in the range from 0 to the number of slices for the sliceViewMode
        iValue - the 4th or i dimension to use for displaying a slice from 4 dimensional data
        sc - the scale object for mapping pixel values to indices in the color lookup table

      • createOverlay

        public java.awt.Component createOverlay(java.lang.Object obj)
        Creates a component based on different data valid for overlaying on top of this component. Returns null if the data isn't valid for overlaying. Duplicates information needed to create the component showing related data at the same location relative to the top left corner as this component. Information such as color model and scaling are not duplicated but instead set to creation defaults that may be preset to provide see through.
        Specified by:
        createOverlay in interface Overlayable
        Parameters:
        obj - data object to base new overlay component on
        Returns:
        component that was created for overlaying or null if invalid object

      • getNonfilteredPoint

        public java.awt.Point getNonfilteredPoint(int[] indices)

        Overrides:
        getNonfilteredPoint in class DisplayComponent
        Parameters:
